column6: The prinicipal purpose of this role is to maintain and develop the commercial success of the Centre with a focus on increasing occupancy and revenue receipts from the hire of conference rooms and ancillary services. This is to be achieved during a period whilst future options for the Centre remain under review.  The Chief Executive will provide vision, direction and leadership. Mark will oversee the formulation and achievement of the Centre's commercial objectives to ensure that the approved targets within the annual Business and Corporate Plan ae met and dividends paid. Mark will be responsible for the overall management and administration of the Centre and act as uts Treasury appointed Accounting Officer. The Chief Executive has a strategic focus, and the role incorporates operational elements as required. Well developed leadership skills will be key to success. Mark is required to work closely with his team to maintain and enhance tha past successful track record of the Centre and to increase occupancy and grow revenues.
